page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The landscape of area 0508 0213 is located 26 miles north-west of London between Luton and St Albans. It lies in the valley of the River Ver on the southern slope of the Chiltern Hills It is mainly countryside but contains the extreme north-west tip of Harpenden and the eastern half of Flamstead village. It is bisected by two major transport routes: A5 and M1. Although outside the London Greenbelt it is an area of greenwedge preventing the building of too many houses which would cause Luton and St Albans to become a continuous built up area. Originally the area would have been covered in mixed deciduous forest, today there are small patches of planted woodland but the main impression is of arable farming.
